info.description: TIDAL API is a [JSON:API](https://jsonapi.org/) Web API that gives access to TIDAL functionality and data.
info.title: TIDAL API - Beta

get.description: Retrieves multiple albums by available filters, or without if applicable.

parameters.description: Server-generated cursor value pointing a certain page of items. Optional, targets first page if not specified
parameters.name: page[cursor]

parameters.description: Allows the client to customize which related resources should be returned. Available options: artists, coverArt, genres, items, owners, providers, similarAlbums

Bad_Request_Response.description: Bad request - The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax or invalid parameters

Internal_Server_Error_Response.description: Internal server error - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

application/vnd.api+json.example: {"errors":[{"code":"METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED","detail":"The resource doesnt support the requested HTTP method: POST"}]}

Method_Not_Allowed_Response.description: Method not allowed - The request method is not allowed for the requested resource

application/vnd.api+json.example: {"errors":[{"code":"NOT_ACCEPTABLE","detail":"Not acceptable response media type on client. Supported media types on server: application/vnd.api+json, application/json"}]}

Not_Acceptable_Response.description: Not acceptable - The requested resource is capable of generating only content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request

application/vnd.api+json.example: {"errors":[{"code":"NOT_FOUND","detail":"The requested resource could not be found"}]}

Not_Found_Response.description: Not found - The requested resource could not be found

Too_Many_Requests_Response.description: Too many requests - The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time

Retry-After.description: Time to wait before making a new request, in seconds.

application/vnd.api+json.example: {"errors":[{"code":"UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE","detail":"Unsupported request media type: application/xml. Expected media type format: application/vnd.api+json"}]}

Unsupported_Media_Type_Response.description: Unsupported media type - The request entity has a media type which the server or resource does not support

externalLinks.description: Album links external to TIDAL API

createdAt.description: Time when the appreciation was created

editable.description: Boolean to indicate if the biography is editable (source = tidal or artist)

text.example: Once upon a time an artist is born

redirectUrl.description: The DSP redirect url used for authentication

retrievedUpcs.description: List of UPCs retrieved from the DSP

contributionsEnabled.description: Is the artist enabled for contributions?

contributionsSalesPitch.example: Help me be a full time artist

externalLinks.description: Artist links external to TIDAL API

followsMyArtist.description: Boolean to indicate if the artist is following my artist

myArtistFollows.description: Boolean to indicate if my artist is following the artist

numberOfTracks.description: Total number of tracks released together with the provider

md5Hash.description: MD5 hash of file to be uploaded

size.description: File size of the artwork in bytes

DrmData.description: DRM data. Absence implies no DRM.

detail.description: human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

id.description: unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem

status.description: HTTP status code applicable to this problem

header.description: string indicating the name of a single request header which caused the error

parameter.description: string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

pointer.description: a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the value in the request document that caused the error

href.description: Href to upload actual file to

additionalProperties.description: HTTP headers that must be added to the operation

headers.description: HTTP headers that must be added to the operation

nextCursor.description: Only cursor part of next link

bounded.description: Indicates if the playlist has a duration and set number of tracks

lastModifiedAt.description: Datetime of last modification of the playlist (ISO 8601)

numberOfItems.description: Number of items in the playlist

md5Hash.description: MD5 hash of file to be uploaded

size.description: File size of the track in bytes

externalLinks.description: Track links external to TIDAL API
Video links external to TIDAL API

scopes.collection.read: Read access to a user's "My Collection".
scopes.collection.write: Write access to a user's "My Collection".
scopes.entitlements.read: Read access to what functionality a user is entitled to access on TIDAL, such as whether they can stream music, use DJ add-ons and similar.
scopes.playback: Required to play media content and control playback.
scopes.playlists.read: Required to list playlists created by a user.
scopes.playlists.write: Write access to a user's playlists.
scopes.recommendations.read: Read access to a users personal recommendations.
scopes.search.read: Required to read personalized search results.
scopes.search.write: Required to update personalized search results, e.g. delete search history.
scopes.user.read: Read access to a user's account information, such as country and email address.
